title: The Birth of Soviet cinema
creator_credit: Maxim Gorky Film Studio Moscow and Harold Mantell
brief_description: Examines the golden age of cinema in Russia in the 1920’s by presenting excerpts from masterworks of Eisenstein, Pudovkin and Dovzhenko by film critic Richard Schickel. Explains why the 1920’s was a productive time for cinema in general.
